info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 27 at 11:05PM MDT until July 28 at 12:30AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM MDT THURSDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN BOULDER COUNTY... At 1105 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Southern Boulder, western Broomfield, Lafayette, Louisville, Superior, Eldorado Springs and Marshall. This includes the following streams and drainages... Boulder Creek, South Boulder Creek, Dry Creek, Bear Canyon Creek, Coal Creek, Rock Creek and Walnut Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Excessive runoff from this storm will cause flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, streets, underpasses, drainage areas and other low lying spots.
